body:
Thanks for the kind words and your immediate interest :)

> Is uptake telemetry suitable for measuring the uptake of each individual recipe? Could we add a unique per-recipe identifier to the source name when calling the API? 

Yes, definitely, you choose the way you build the key for each source (e.g. `shield-recipe-{id}` would be valid).

I haven't looked it into it yet, but I'm pretty confident that we could aggregate all the keys that start with a string (e.g. `LIKE 'shield-recipe-%'`).

> Also, for Telemetry I'm mostly familiar with ATMO and ReDash. How are we expected to view the data being sent?

Since the underlying tools are just plain telemetry — keyed and categorical — histograms, you shouldn't have any issue with this. 
If I remember well, according to Rob, the challenge is to find a good sampling strategy. 

We should definitely add some guidelines (or query templates) somewhere to ease the retrieval of data.

If you need some help, or want to share some feedback, please don't hesitate to ping me :)
